description: Retention of change of use of single family dwellinghouse (Use Class C3) to House in Multiple Occupation (Large HMO) (Use Class Sui Generis) with 9 bedroom for 10 people  and associated external and internal alterations (for a period of 5 years)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall expire 5 years from the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the temporary permission that has been applied for.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawing title number(s): 81DR_E&PRE-EX_BP_A (Existing and pre-existing block Plan); 81DR_EX_LP_version 01 (location plan); 81DR_EX_E version 01 (existing elevations); 81DR_EX_E2 version 01 (existing elevations); 81DR_EX_E010_A version 01 (existing ground floor plan); 81DR_EX_011_A version 01 (existing first floor plan); 81DR_EX_012_A version 01 (existing second floor plan)
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| The HMO shall install an enhanced sound insulation value DnT,w [and L'nT,w] of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling /wall structures separating different types of rooms/ uses in adjoining dwellings, namely bedroom adjacent to staircase, living/dining room and kitchen above/below bedroom of separate dwellings shall be implemented and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise, in accordance with  policy D6 of the London Plan(2021); policies 1.1(j) & 1.2(f) of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) and with policies 3.5 and 7A of the Ealing's Development Management Plan Document.
| The house in multiple occupation hereby approved shall be limited to no more than ten (10) occupants living within nine (9) bedrooms.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of occupiers of the area and in the interests of the future occupants of the development in accordance with policies with policies 3.5 and 7B of the Ealing Development Management Plan 2013, policies 1.1 (e) of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy and The London Plan (2021) policy D6. | Within five (5) months of this permission being granted, photographs to demonstrate the presence of two (2) working cook tops, each with at least 4 cooking rings within the communal kitchen shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. Two cook tops shall be retained for the lifetime of the development hereby approved.

Reason: To ensure the large house of multiple occupation (HMO) would provide the adequate living standards required to accommodate at least ten (10) occupants in accordance with London Plan(2021) policy D6 and Ealing's Development Management DPD(2013) policy 3.5; the London Housing SPG; and Ealing's HMO standards.

| Within 3 months of the date of this decision, at least ten (10) secure and covered cycle parking spaces shall be provided within the rear garden of the site and shall be retained for the lifetime of the development hereby approved.
Reason: To encourage sustainable transport modes in accordance with Policy T5 of the London Plan(2021)

| A screened refuse storage and recycling enclosure within the forecourt of the property shall be implemented within 3 months of the date of this permission and shall be sited as far as possible behind the existing strip of vegetation along the front boundary of the site. Refuse storage capacity shall be provided in accordance with BS5906:2005, and shall be fully implemented and made available for use. The enclosure shall be retained for use at all times for the lifetime of the development hereby approved.

Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory facilities for the storage of refuse and recycling material, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Adopted Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012) policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy D6 and table 3.2 of the London Plan (2021)
